articles.description: Aston Villa top the Champions League table after beating Bolgona, Arsenal defeat Shakhtar plus build-up to Man City, Liverpool & Celtic's matches.
articles.title: Champions League reaction: Aston Villa, Arsenal, Real Madrid, Vinicius Jr

articles.description: Minutes after Real Madrid fans were singing for Vinicius Jr to win the Ballon d'Or, the Brazil forward insisted he wants to "stay at the club forever".
articles.title: 'Extraordinary' Vinicius Jr favourite for Ballon d'Or

articles.description: Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James and his son Bronny make history after becoming the first father-son duo to share the court in an NBA game.
articles.title: LeBron James: Los Angeles Lakers star makes NBA history by playing with son Bronny in season-opening win over Minnesota Timberwolves

articles.description: Barcelona and Bayern Munich will meet each other for the 11th time in Champions League history when they face off on Wednesday night.
articles.title: Barcelona v Bayern Munich: Remembering five epic Champions League matches

articles.description: The ball struck by LA Dodgers hitter Shohei Ohtani when he secured a record-breaking 50th home run sells for £3.39m at auction.
articles.title: Shohei Ohtani's '50-50' baseball sells for record £3.39m at auction

articles.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says defender Riccardo Calafiori's injury during the 1-0 win over Shakhtar Donetsk is " a bit of a worry."
articles.title: Riccardo Calafiori: Injury 'a worry' for Arsenal who have 'questions to answer' after Shakhtar win

articles.description: Brest's rise from amateur football to the Champions League is "magic", but will they maintain a 100% start in Europe?
articles.title: Champions League: Brest go from amateur football to Real Madrid date in Europe

articles.description: Wakefield Trinity will replace London Broncos in Super League for 2025 having been awarded Grade A status as part of a restructure of rugby league starting next season.
articles.title: Super League: Wakefield replace London for 2025 having achieved Grade A status

articles.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu pulls out of a fifth tournament in a row, the Hong Kong Open, after spraining ligaments in her foot.
articles.title: Emma Raducanu: Hong Kong Open withdrawal despite "good progress" from injury

articles.description: Former England goalkeeper Karen Bardsley explains why nothing is decided yet in Hannah Hampton's battle with Mary Earps to be first-choice for the Lionesses.
articles.title: Karen Bardsley column: Is England's number one shirt in Hannah Hampton's hands?
